intro: Achyrocline stenoptera, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and daisy-like white flowers with yellow centers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. The species is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
